lib.jog

Class input

  • java.lang.Object
    • lib.jog.input

  • public abstract class input
extends java.lang.Object

    jog.input

    Provides a layer for the LWJGL libraries' Mouse and Keyboard classes. jog.input gives all necessary methods, abstracting away, but also allowing for extension.

    Author:
    IMP1

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  input.EventHandler
      Interface for a class that is to receive keyboard and mouse events.

      • update

        public static void update(input.EventHandler handler)
        Updates the input buffer, collecting keyboard and mouse events
        Parameters:

      • isKeyDown

        public static boolean isKeyDown(int key)
        Accesses whether the state of the specified key on the keyboard.
        Parameters:
        key - the integer representation of the keyboard key being pressed
        Returns:
        whether the key is currently depressed.

      • isMouseDown

        public static boolean isMouseDown(int button)
        Accesses whether the state of the specified button on the mouse.
        Parameters:
        button - the integer representation of the mouse button being pressed
        Returns:
        whether the button is currently depressed.

      • isMouseInRect

        public static boolean isMouseInRect(int x,
                    int y,
                    int width,
                    int height)
        Accesses the coordinates of the mouse relative to a rectangle on the window
        Parameters:
        x - the rectangle's window x coordinate
        y - the rectangle's window y coordinate
        width - the rectangle's width
        height - the rectangle's height
        Returns:
        whether the mouse's coordinates are in the rectangle

      • mouseX

        public static int mouseX()
        Access the horizontal coordinate of the mouse's position, with the upper left being the origin.
        Returns:
        the current x coordinate of the mouse

      • mouseY

        public static int mouseY()
        Access the vertical coordinate of the mouse's position, with the upper left being the origin.
        Returns:
        the current y coordinate of the mouse
